questions.question: Which of these programming languages is the oldest?

correct_answer.comment: Believe it or not, Python is the oldest of these languages. It was first released in 1991.

incorrect_answers.comment: Java was first released in 1995.
Ruby was first released in 1995.
PHP was first released in 1995.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a JavaScript library?

correct_answer.comment: How about that? This name was telling the truth!

incorrect_answers.comment: It’s real! It randomly deletes half the files in the project.
Yup, it’s a thing. It makes fart sounds when pages are scrolled.
It actually exists, and it makes images load as slowly as you want.

questions.question: Which company developed the Java programming language?

correct_answer.comment: Java was developed by Sun Microsystems, which was acquired by Oracle.

incorrect_answers.comment: No, but Microsoft made an “embrace, extend, extinguish” lookalike language called Visual J++.
No, but Apple has its own language, Swift.
No, but IBM developed a number of languages, including FORTRAN, PL/1, and APL.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a character encoding?

correct_answer.comment: PLUGH is not a character encoding, but a magic word from the original Adventure game.

incorrect_answers.comment: Unicode is most definitely a character encoding standard. It’s probably the one being used by this app!
ASCII is a character encoding standard that represents text in computers.
It’s not really used anymore, but it was once popular in mainframe environments.

questions.question: What’s the maximum number of devices that can be connected in a single USB chain?

correct_answer.comment: USB uses a 7-bit addressing scheme and reserves address 0 as a temporary address for devices that have just been plugged in.

incorrect_answers.comment: You’d think that was the case, but it can handle more.
A likely number, but that’s wrong.
Close, but no cigar.

questions.question: What’s the standard port number for HTTPS?

incorrect_answers.comment: No, port 80 is used for HTTP, without the “S”.
No, port 8080 is used for HTTP alternate.
No, port 21 is used for FTP.

questions.question: Which company created the first commercial microprocessor?

correct_answer.comment: Intel created the first commercial microprocessor, the 4004, in 1971.

incorrect_answers.comment: No, AMD didn’t even get into the business until 1975, four years after the first microprocessor.
No, Motorola wouldn’t create their first microprocessor, the 6800, until three years after the first microprocessor.
No, IBM was a major player in early computing but didn't create the first microprocessor.
